00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_uint_base.h -- An unsigned integer whose length is less than 64 bits.
00023 
00024                Unlike arbitrary precision, arithmetic and bitwise operations
00025                are performed using the native types (hence capped at 64 bits).
00026                The sc_uint integer is useful when the user does not need
00027                arbitrary precision and the performance is superior to
00028                sc_bigint/sc_biguint.
00029 
00030   Original Author: Amit Rao, Synopsys, Inc.
00031 
00032  *****************************************************************************/
00033 
00034 /*****************************************************************************
00035 
00036   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00037   changes you are making here.
00038 
00039       Name, Affiliation, Date: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00040   Description of Modification: - Resolved ambiguity with sc_(un)signed.
00041                                - Merged the code for 64- and 32-bit versions
00042                                  via the constants in sc_nbdefs.h.
00043                                - Eliminated redundant file inclusions.
00044 
00045       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00046   Description of Modification:
00047 
00048  *****************************************************************************/
00049

00129 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130 //  CLASS : sc_uint_bitref_r
00131 //
00132 //  Proxy class for sc_uint bit selection (r-value only).
00133 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134 
00135 class SC_API sc_uint_bitref_r : public sc_value_base
00136 {
00137     friend class sc_uint_base;
00138     friend class sc_uint_signal;
00139 
00140 
00141     // constructors
00142 
00143 public:
00144     sc_uint_bitref_r( const sc_uint_bitref_r& init ) :
00145          sc_value_base(init), m_index(init.m_index), m_obj_p(init.m_obj_p)
00146          {}
00147 
00148 protected:
00149     sc_uint_bitref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_index(0), m_obj_p(0)
00150         {}
00151 
00152     // initializer for sc_core::sc_vpool:
00153 
00154     void initialize( const sc_uint_base* obj_p, int index_ )
00155     {
00156         m_obj_p = (sc_uint_base*)obj_p;
00157         m_index = index_;
00158     }
00159 
00160 public:
00161 
00162     // destructor
00163 
00164     virtual ~sc_uint_bitref_r()
00165         {}
00166 
00167     // concatenation support
00168 
00169     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00170         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return 1; }
00171     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00172         {
00173             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00174             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00175 
00176             dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00177             return false;
00178         }
00179     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const
00180         {
00181             int  bit_mask = 1 << (low_i % BITS_PER_DIGIT);
00182             bool result;             // True is non-zero.
00183             int  word_i = low_i / BITS_PER_DIGIT;
00184 
00185             if ( operator uint64() )
00186             {
00187                 dst_p[word_i] |= bit_mask;
00188                 result = true;
00189             }
00190             else
00191             {
00192                 dst_p[word_i] &= ~bit_mask;
00193                 result = false;
00194             }
00195             return result;
00196         }
00197     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00198         { return operator uint64(); }
00199 
00200     // capacity
00201 
00202     int length() const
00203         { return 1; }
00204 
00205 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00206     int bitwidth() const
00207         { return length(); }
00208 #endif
00209 
00210 
00211     // implicit conversion to uint64
00212 
00213     operator uint64 () const;
00214     bool operator ! () const;
00215     bool operator ~ () const;
00216 
00217 
00218     // explicit conversions
00219 
00220     uint64 value() const
00221         { return operator uint64 (); }
00222 
00223     bool to_bool() const
00224         { return operator uint64 (); }
00225 
00226 
00227     // other methods
00228 
00229     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00230         { os << to_bool(); }
00231 
00232 protected:
00233 
00234     int           m_index;
00235     sc_uint_base* m_obj_p;
00236 
00237 private:
00238 
00239     // disabled
00240     sc_uint_bitref_r& operator = ( const sc_uint_bitref_r& );
00241 };
00242 
00243 
00244 
00245 inline
00246 ::std::ostream&
00247 operator << ( ::std::ostream&, const sc_uint_bitref_r& );

00313 class SC_API sc_uint_subref_r : public sc_value_base
00314 {
00315     friend class sc_uint_base;
00316         friend class sc_uint_subref;
00317 
00318 
00319     // constructors
00320 
00321 public:
00322     sc_uint_subref_r( const sc_uint_subref_r& init ) :
00323         sc_value_base(init), m_left(init.m_left), m_obj_p(init.m_obj_p),
00324         m_right(init.m_right)
00325         {}
00326 
00327 protected:
00328     sc_uint_subref_r() : sc_value_base(), m_left(0), m_obj_p(0), m_right(0)
00329         {}
00330 
00331     // initializer for sc_core::sc_vpool:
00332 
00333     void initialize( const sc_uint_base* obj_p, int left_i, int right_i )
00334     {
00335         m_obj_p = (sc_uint_base*)obj_p;
00336         m_left = left_i;
00337         m_right = right_i;
00338     }
00339 
00340 public:
00341 
00342     // destructor
00343 
00344     virtual ~sc_uint_subref_r()
00345         {}
00346 
00347     // capacity
00348 
00349     int length() const
00350         { return ( m_left - m_right + 1 ); }
00351 
00352 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00353     int bitwidth() const
00354         { return length(); }
00355 #endif
00356 
00357     // concatenation support
00358 
00359     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00360         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return length(); }
00361     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00362     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00363     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00364         { return (uint64)operator uint_type(); }
00365 
00366 
00367     // reduce methods
00368 
00369     bool and_reduce() const;
00370 
00371     bool nand_reduce() const
00372         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
00373 
00374     bool or_reduce() const;
00375 
00376     bool nor_reduce() const
00377         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
00378 
00379     bool xor_reduce() const;
00380 
00381     bool xnor_reduce() const
00382         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
00383 
00384 
00385     // implicit conversion to uint_type
00386 
00387     operator uint_type() const;
00388 
00389 
00390     // explicit conversions
00391 
00392     uint_type value() const
00393         { return operator uint_type(); }
00394 
00395 
00396     int           to_int() const;
00397     unsigned int  to_uint() const;
00398     long          to_long() const;
00399     unsigned long to_ulong() const;
00400     int64         to_int64() const;
00401     uint64        to_uint64() const;
00402     double        to_double() const;
00403 
00404 
00405     // explicit conversion to character string
00406 
00407     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00408     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00409 
00410 
00411     // other methods
00412 
00413     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00414         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00415 
00416 protected:
00417 
00418     int           m_left;
00419     sc_uint_base* m_obj_p;
00420     int           m_right;
00421 
00422 private:
00423 
00424     // disabled
00425     sc_uint_subref_r& operator = ( const sc_uint_subref_r& );
00426 };

00524 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00525 //  CLASS : sc_uint_base
00526 //
00527 //  Base class for sc_uint.
00528 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00529 
00530 class SC_API sc_uint_base : public sc_value_base
00531 {
00532     friend class sc_uint_bitref_r;
00533     friend class sc_uint_bitref;
00534     friend class sc_uint_subref_r;
00535     friend class sc_uint_subref;
00536 
00537 
00538     // support methods
00539 
00540     void invalid_length() const;
00541     void invalid_index( int i ) const;
00542     void invalid_range( int l, int r ) const;
00543 
00544     void check_length() const
00545         { if( m_len <= 0 || m_len > SC_INTWIDTH ) { invalid_length(); } }
00546 
00547     void check_index( int i ) const
00548         { if( i < 0 || i >= m_len ) { invalid_index( i ); } }
00549 
00550     void check_range( int l, int r ) const
00551         { if( r < 0 || l >= m_len || l < r ) { invalid_range( l, r ); } }
00552 
00553     void check_value() const;
00554 
00555     void extend_sign()
00556         {
00557 #ifdef DEBUG_SYSTEMC
00558             check_value();
00559 #endif
00560             m_val &= ( ~UINT_ZERO >> m_ulen );
00561         }
00562 
00563 public:
00564 
00565     // constructors
00566 
00567     explicit sc_uint_base( int w = sc_length_param().len() )
00568         : m_val( 0 ), m_len( w ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00569         { check_length(); }
00570 
00571     sc_uint_base( uint_type v, int w )
00572         : m_val( v ), m_len( w ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00573         { check_length(); extend_sign(); }
00574 
00575     sc_uint_base( const sc_uint_base& a )
00576         : sc_value_base(a), m_val(a.m_val), m_len(a.m_len), m_ulen(a.m_ulen)
00577         {}
00578 
00579     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_uint_subref_r& a )
00580         : m_val( a ), m_len( a.length() ), m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00581         { extend_sign(); }
00582 
00583     template<class T>
00584     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00585         : m_val( a->to_uint64() ), m_len( a->length() ),
00586           m_ulen( SC_INTWIDTH - m_len )
00587         { check_length(); extend_sign(); }
00588 
00589     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_bv_base& v );
00590     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_lv_base& v );
00591     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_int_subref_r& v );
00592     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_signed_subref_r& v );
00593     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_unsigned_subref_r& v );
00594     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_signed& a );
00595     explicit sc_uint_base( const sc_unsigned& a );
00596 
00597 
00598     // destructor
00599 
00600     virtual ~sc_uint_base()
00601         {}
00602 
00603 
00604     // assignment operators
00605 
00606     sc_uint_base& operator = ( uint_type v )
00607         { m_val = v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00608 
00609     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_uint_base& a )
00610         { m_val = a.m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00611 
00612     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_uint_subref_r& a )
00613         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00614 
00615     template<class T>
00616     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00617         { m_val = a->to_uint64(); extend_sign(); return *this; }
00618 
00619     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_signed& a );
00620     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_unsigned& a );
00621 
00622 #ifdef SC_INCLUDE_FX
00623     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_fxval& a );
00624     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_fxval_fast& a );
00625     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_fxnum& a );
00626     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_fxnum_fast& a );
00627 #endif
00628 
00629     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_bv_base& a );
00630     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const sc_lv_base& a );
00631 
00632     sc_uint_base& operator = ( const char* a );
00633 
00634     sc_uint_base& operator = ( unsigned long a )
00635         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00636 
00637     sc_uint_base& operator = ( long a )
00638         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00639 
00640     sc_uint_base& operator = ( unsigned int a )
00641         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00642 
00643     sc_uint_base& operator = ( int a )
00644         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00645 
00646     sc_uint_base& operator = ( int64 a )
00647         { m_val = a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00648 
00649     sc_uint_base& operator = ( double a )
00650         { m_val = (uint_type) a; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00651 
00652 
00653     // arithmetic assignment operators
00654 
00655     sc_uint_base& operator += ( uint_type v )
00656         { m_val += v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00657 
00658     sc_uint_base& operator -= ( uint_type v )
00659         { m_val -= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00660 
00661     sc_uint_base& operator *= ( uint_type v )
00662         { m_val *= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00663 
00664     sc_uint_base& operator /= ( uint_type v )
00665         { m_val /= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00666 
00667     sc_uint_base& operator %= ( uint_type v )
00668         { m_val %= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00669 
00670 
00671     // bitwise assignment operators
00672 
00673     sc_uint_base& operator &= ( uint_type v )
00674         { m_val &= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00675 
00676     sc_uint_base& operator |= ( uint_type v )
00677         { m_val |= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00678 
00679     sc_uint_base& operator ^= ( uint_type v )
00680         { m_val ^= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00681 
00682 
00683     sc_uint_base& operator <<= ( uint_type v )
00684         { m_val <<= v; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00685 
00686     sc_uint_base& operator >>= ( uint_type v )
00687         { m_val >>= v; /* no sign extension needed */ return *this; }
00688 
00689 
00690     // prefix and postfix increment and decrement operators
00691 
00692     sc_uint_base& operator ++ () // prefix
00693         { ++ m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00694 
00695     const sc_uint_base operator ++ ( int ) // postfix
00696         { sc_uint_base tmp( *this ); ++ m_val; extend_sign(); return tmp; }
00697 
00698     sc_uint_base& operator -- () // prefix
00699         { -- m_val; extend_sign(); return *this; }
00700 
00701     const sc_uint_base operator -- ( int ) // postfix
00702         { sc_uint_base tmp( *this ); -- m_val; extend_sign(); return tmp; }
00703 
00704 
00705     // relational operators
00706 
00707     friend bool operator == ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00708         { return a.m_val == b.m_val; }
00709 
00710     friend bool operator != ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00711         { return a.m_val != b.m_val; }
00712 
00713     friend bool operator <  ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00714         { return a.m_val < b.m_val; }
00715 
00716     friend bool operator <= ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00717         { return a.m_val <= b.m_val; }
00718 
00719     friend bool operator >  ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00720         { return a.m_val > b.m_val; }
00721 
00722     friend bool operator >= ( const sc_uint_base& a, const sc_uint_base& b )
00723         { return a.m_val >= b.m_val; }
00724 
00725 
00726     // bit selection
00727 
00728     sc_uint_bitref&         operator [] ( int i );
00729     const sc_uint_bitref_r& operator [] ( int i ) const;
00730 
00731     sc_uint_bitref&         bit( int i );
00732     const sc_uint_bitref_r& bit( int i ) const;
00733 
00734 
00735     // part selection
00736 
00737     sc_uint_subref&         operator () ( int left, int right );
00738     const sc_uint_subref_r& operator () ( int left, int right ) const;
00739 
00740     sc_uint_subref&         range( int left, int right );
00741     const sc_uint_subref_r& range( int left, int right ) const;
00742 
00743 
00744     // bit access, without bounds checking or sign extension
00745 
00746     bool test( int i ) const
00747         { return ( 0 != (m_val & (UINT_ONE << i)) ); }
00748 
00749     void set( int i )
00750         { m_val |= (UINT_ONE << i); }
00751 
00752     void set( int i, bool v )
00753         { v ? m_val |= (UINT_ONE << i) : m_val &= ~(UINT_ONE << i); }
00754 
00755 
00756     // capacity
00757 
00758     int length() const
00759         { return m_len; }
00760 
00761 #ifdef SC_DT_DEPRECATED
00762     int bitwidth() const
00763         { return length(); }
00764 #endif
00765 
00766     // concatenation support
00767 
00768     virtual int concat_length(bool* xz_present_p) const
00769         { if ( xz_present_p ) *xz_present_p = false; return length(); }
00770     virtual bool concat_get_ctrl( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00771     virtual bool concat_get_data( sc_digit* dst_p, int low_i ) const;
00772     virtual uint64 concat_get_uint64() const
00773         { return m_val; }
00774     virtual void concat_set(int64 src, int low_i);
00775     virtual void concat_set(const sc_signed& src, int low_i);
00776     virtual void concat_set(const sc_unsigned& src, int low_i);
00777     virtual void concat_set(uint64 src, int low_i);
00778 
00779 
00780     // reduce methods
00781 
00782     bool and_reduce() const;
00783 
00784     bool nand_reduce() const
00785         { return ( ! and_reduce() ); }
00786 
00787     bool or_reduce() const;
00788 
00789     bool nor_reduce() const
00790         { return ( ! or_reduce() ); }
00791 
00792     bool xor_reduce() const;
00793 
00794     bool xnor_reduce() const
00795         { return ( ! xor_reduce() ); }
00796 
00797 
00798     // implicit conversion to uint_type
00799 
00800     operator uint_type() const
00801         { return m_val; }
00802 
00803 
00804     // explicit conversions
00805 
00806     uint_type value() const
00807         { return operator uint_type(); }
00808 
00809 
00810     int to_int() const
00811         { return (int) m_val; }
00812 
00813     unsigned int to_uint() const
00814         { return (unsigned int) m_val; }
00815 
00816     long to_long() const
00817         { return (long) m_val; }
00818 
00819     unsigned long to_ulong() const
00820         { return (unsigned long) m_val; }
00821 
00822     int64 to_int64() const
00823         { return (int64) m_val; }
00824 
00825     uint64 to_uint64() const
00826         { return (uint64) m_val; }
00827 
00828     double to_double() const
00829         { return uint64_to_double( m_val ); }
00830 
00831 
00832     long long_low() const
00833         { return (long) (m_val & UINT64_32ONES); }
00834 
00835     long long_high() const
00836         { return (long) ((m_val >> 32) & UINT64_32ONES); }
00837 
00838 
00839     // explicit conversion to character string
00840 
00841     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep = SC_DEC ) const;
00842     const std::string to_string( sc_numrep numrep, bool w_prefix ) const;
00843 
00844 
00845     // other methods
00846 
00847     void print( ::std::ostream& os = ::std::cout ) const
00848         { os << to_string(sc_io_base(os,SC_DEC),sc_io_show_base(os)); }
00849 
00850     void scan( ::std::istream& is = ::std::cin );
00851 
00852 protected:
00853 
00854     uint_type m_val;   // value
00855     int       m_len;   // length
00856     int       m_ulen;  // unused length
00857 };

00877 // implicit conversion to bool
00878 
00879 inline
00880 sc_uint_bitref_r::operator uint64 () const
00881 {
00882     return m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00883 }
00884 
00885 inline
00886 bool
00887 sc_uint_bitref_r::operator ! () const
00888 {
00889     return ! m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00890 }
00891 
00892 inline
00893 bool
00894 sc_uint_bitref_r::operator ~ () const
00895 {
00896     return ! m_obj_p->test( m_index );
00897 }

00919 sc_uint_bitref&
00920 sc_uint_bitref::operator = ( const sc_uint_bitref_r& b )
00921 {
00922     m_obj_p->set( m_index, b.to_bool() );
00923     return *this;
00924 }
00925

00927 sc_uint_bitref&
00928 sc_uint_bitref::operator = ( const sc_uint_bitref& b )
00929 {
00930     m_obj_p->set( m_index, b.to_bool() );
00931     return *this;
00932 }
00933 
00934 inline
00935 sc_uint_bitref&
00936 sc_uint_bitref::operator = ( bool b )
00937 {
00938     m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00939     return *this;
00940 }
00941 
00942 
00943 inline
00944 sc_uint_bitref&
00945 sc_uint_bitref::operator &= ( bool b )
00946 {
00947     if( ! b ) {
00948         m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00949     }
00950     return *this;
00951 }
00952 
00953 inline
00954 sc_uint_bitref&
00955 sc_uint_bitref::operator |= ( bool b )
00956 {
00957     if( b ) {
00958         m_obj_p->set( m_index, b );
00959     }
00960     return *this;
00961 }
00962 
00963 inline
00964 sc_uint_bitref&
00965 sc_uint_bitref::operator ^= ( bool b )
00966 {
00967     if( b ) {
00968         m_obj_p->m_val ^= (UINT_ONE << m_index);
00969     }
00970     return *this;
00971 }
00972

00978 {
00979     a.scan( is );
00980     return is;

00984 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00985 //  CLASS : sc_uint_subref_r
00986 //
00987 //  Proxy class for sc_uint part selection (r-value only).
00988 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00989 
00990 // implicit conversion to uint_type
00991 
00992 inline
00993 sc_uint_subref_r::operator uint_type() const
00994 {
00995     uint_type val = m_obj_p->m_val;
00996     int uleft = SC_INTWIDTH - (m_left + 1);
00997     return ( (val & (~UINT_ZERO >> uleft)) >> m_right );
00998 }

01203 inline
01204 sc_uint_bitref&
01205 sc_uint_base::operator [] ( int i )
01206 {
01207     check_index( i );
01208     sc_uint_bitref* result_p = sc_uint_bitref::m_pool.allocate();
01209     result_p->initialize(this, i);
01210     return *result_p;
01211 }

01219     result_p->initialize(this, i);
01220     return *result_p;
01221 }
